column17: When looking for the autosomal version of the y-linked gene in the same species; we're looking for the paralog (genes within the same organism that arose through gene duplication, often performing similar but not identical function). Paralogs and Orthologs both fall under the general term of Homology but are separated by duplication and speciation respectively.
